Srce parajoče: to 77-letnik vsak dan stori za svojo bolno ženo
Z invalidskim vozičkom jo vozi do ambulante, ki je od doma oddaljena več kilometrov.
03 Nov 2019, 08:04 by N. B.
Stevan Milijašević (77) iz kraja Glamočani vsak dan z ženo Anđelko (84), ki je na invalidskem vozičku, prehodi več kot pet kilometrov. V tamkajšnji ambulanti ji namreč že osem mesecev dnevno previjajo rano. Anđelka trpi za sladkorno boleznijo, odstraniti so ji morali prste na nogi in del stopala. Kmalu je postala nepokretna.Ob lepem vremenu se tako vsakodnevno odpravita peš na prevezovanje. Obisk medicinske sestre, ki bi Anđelko oskrbela na domu, stane 10 mark (pet evrov), zato si ga 77-letnik z nizko pokojnino težko privošči.
S pokojnino komaj pokrije zdravila
Starejši par bližnjih sorodnikov, ki bi jima lahko pomagali, nima, živita le od Stevanove skromne pokojnine, ki komaj pokrije zdravila. Tudi sam je namreč slabega zdravja. K sreči jima je sokrajanka podarila vsaj invalidski voziček, ki jima služi kot prevozno sredstvo.Na tamkajšnji center za socialno delo par ne more računati. Stevanu in Anđelki tako ostaja le upanje, da se ju bodo patronažne sestre v zimskih mesecih usmilile in jima svojih obiskov ne bodo računale, poroča srbski Kurir.

Heartbreaking: This 77-year-old man commits for his sick wife every day
In a wheelchair, she drives her to an ambulance several kilometers away.
03 Nov 2019, 08:04 by N. B.
Stevan Milijašević (77) from Glamočani daily walks more than five kilometers with his wife Anđelka (84) in a wheelchair. For eight months, she has been wounded daily in an ambulance there. Angela suffers from diabetes, having to remove her toes and part of her foot. It soon became immobile. In fine weather, they thus go daily for a walk on foot. A visit to a nurse to help Angelica at home costs 10 marks (five euros), so the 77-year-old with a low pension is hard to afford.
He barely covers medicines with his pension
An older couple of close relatives who could not help them, they only live off Stevan's modest pension, which barely covers medicines. He himself is in bad health. Thankfully, the Socrates donated at least a wheelchair to them, which serves them as a means of transportation. The couple cannot count on the social work center there. Stevan and Anđelka thus only hope that the nurses will have mercy on them during the winter months and will not count their visits, the Serbian Courier reports.
